sense.def:
Če človek
catches an animal or person
, ulovi neko žival ali človeka.

seg.quote: I went fishing and caught a nice little trout.
...a wild otter caught in a trap.
We can get six months in prison if they catch us.

sense.def:
To catch an object
pomeni prijeti neki predmet, medtem ko se premika po zraku.

seg.quote: ‘Catch,’ said Howard. He threw the book over to her.
The wind caught her hat.

sense.def:
To catch someone doing something wrong
pomeni odkriti človeka, ki počne nekaj slabega v trenutku, ko tisto počne.

seg.quote: A gardener was sacked if he was caught smoking.
Don't let him catch you at it.

sense.def:
Kadar ena stvar
catches another one
, z veliko silo udari ob drugo.

seg.quote: The wave caught the trawler on her bow.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
catches on an object
, se ujame v drug predmet.

seg.quote: There was a bit of rabbit's fur caught on the fence.
He caught his fingers in the spokes of the wheel.

sense.def:
To catch a bus, train, or plane
pomeni stopiti na avtobus, vlak ali letalo, da bi nekam odpotovali.

seg.quote: She caught a train to Boston.

sense.def:
Če človek
cannot catch something
, se mu ne posreči, da bi slišal tisto, kar je nekdo rekel.

seg.quote: She whispered something he could not catch.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
catches one's interest, imagination, or attention
, tisto opazimo ali se za tisto začnemo zanimati.

seg.quote: A poster caught her attention.

sense.def:
Če je človek
caught in a storm or other unpleasant situation
, se ne more izogniti posledicam nevihte ali neprijetnih okoliščin.

seg.quote: They were caught in an earthquake.

sense.def:
To catch a cold or a disease
pomeni nalesti se prehlada ali dobiti kakšno drugo bolezen.

Kadar nekaj
catches the light
ali kadar svetloba
catches something
, svetloba odseva od tistega predmeta, da je videti svetel in bleščeč.

seg.quote: The grass is sparkling where the sunlight catches small drops from the rain.

sense.def:
A catch
je naprava, s katero se okno ali vrata zapirajo.

seg.quote: He put his hand through the hole in the glass and released the catch.

sense.def:
A catch
je tudi prikrit problem ali težava v načrtu ali poteku dejanja.

seg.quote: ‘There's a catch in this.’—‘There's no catch, Gordon. I swear it.’

sense.def:
To catch at something
pomeni hitro nekaj prijeti.

seg.quote: The children caught at my skirts and tugged me back.

sense.def:
To catch on to something
pomeni nekaj razumeti ali ugotoviti, da se nekaj dogaja.

seg.quote: You were expected to catch on quick.
They finally caught on to our game.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
catches on
, postane priljubljeno.

seg.quote: Ballroom dancing caught on.

sense.def:
To catch someone out
pomeni prisiliti nekoga, da naredi napako, največkrat z nepošteno ukano.

seg.quote: Are you trying to catch me out?

sense.def:
To catch up with someone
pomeni nekoga doseči tako, da hodimo hitreje kot on.

seg.quote: Tim had just reached the corner when Judy caught up with him.
She stood still, allowing him to catch her up.

sense.def:
To catch up with someone
pomeni tudi doseči enako raven kakor nekdo drug.

seg.quote: Most leaders were obsessed with catching up with the West.

sense.def:
To catch up on an activity
pomeni, da se več ukvarjamo z dejavnostjo, za katero prej nismo imeli dovolj časa.

seg.quote: They went to the office to catch up on correspondence.
I was catching up on my sleep.

sense.def:
To be caught up in something
pomeni biti v nekaj vpleten, navadno nehote.

seg.quote: He was determined not to get caught up in any publicity nonsense.

sense.def:
Kadar človek
catches up with someone
, se mu posreči najti človeka, ki je storil nekaj slabega.

seg.quote: When Birmingham authorities finally caught up with her, she had spent all the money.

sense.def:
Če nekaj
catches up with someone
, se tisti človek znajde v neprijetnem položaju, ki se ga je dotlej izogibal, zdaj pa se mora spopasti z njim.

seg.quote: I am sure that the truth will catch up with him.
